metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33833 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ConnMan (aka Connection Manager) 1.30 through 1.39 has a stack-based buffer overflow in uncompress in dnsproxy.c via NAME, RDATA, or RDLENGTH (for A or AAAA).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33833` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

connman - 1.36-2ubuntu0.1
connman-vpn - 1.36-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: connman package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.36-2ubuntu0.1').
